CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in New Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 28, 1967, page 1, reads: "Mothers March. A Group of some 30 mothers from the Northview Heights Public Housing Community presented a demand to School Supt. Sidney P. Marland Wednesday morning that Mrs. Helen Amos, a teacher at Northview Heights Elementary, be transferred from the school because of her views on public housing residents which she expressed in a letter to the New Courier (Oct. 21). Dr. Marland had not reached a decision at presstime. Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Men and women protesting with signs reading "To Heaven with Mrs. Amos" and "We don't like rats either" outside Pittsburgh Board of Education building, Oakland
